DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Specimen Characteristic Most Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Greatest in amount, extent, or degree.:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Specimen Characteristic
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord.  Representative examples of primary neoplasms include astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma, ependymoma, and meningioma.  Representative examples of metastatic neoplasms include carcinoma and leukemia.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree.:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.
